channel.title: Best NZ related online gaming router?
channel.description:
Well for a while now I've got into online gaming but seem to fail, I've got the skill just not the connection. As most know MW2 is a game I like to play the most and the three things you need to improve is, fast reaction, HDTV and [u]Good Connection[/u]. Yet I have but not good connection. But if you could kindly help me find the reason for my bad connection whether its where I live or my router is just a piece of shit (Belkin N300). For 1 month I had unlimited GB and slow connection but unlimited GB and fast connection was simply just to much to afford, but I was wondering if I get unlimited GB and fast connection if it would help online gaming connections.
All help is greatly appreciated. Thank You.

btw avp has bad connectivity too

item.title: Best NZ related online gaming router?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

An easy, quick way to make sure your router is not the problem is to bypass it. Unhook the router and plug your computer (or xbox, or ps3, etc etc) directly into the modem, if the results are the same it is your connection, if things speed up it is your router.

Read full topic
item.source: Best NZ related online gaming router?

item.title: Best NZ related online gaming router?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Cruzer:

in mw2, chances are its not your connection thats bad. the whole game is shit, have you tried other games?

Yeah, I recently bought AvP and Battlefield Bad Company 2
In AvP it took me 5 minutes to find a game but Battlefield is about who spots who first. No joining in problems
